channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Amid commuter woes, PUV augmentation still hinges on return to GCQ
item.description: "Come August 19, may makikita na pong buses with left doors, and this will be gradually increased over time."

item.title: Palace: Philippine clinical trials of Russian COVID-19 vaccine to start in October
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte will not be part of the clinical trials for the 'Sputnik V' vaccine.

item.title: Robredo urges DepEd to realign P29-billion budget to fund distance learning, health concerns
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: "Around P29.5 billion was earmarked for the rehabilitation of school buildings for 2020...This amount can be used to procure the needed gadgets and equipment for distance learning, as well as address the health concerns of educators," Robredo said.

item.title: Two immigration officers charged for alleged falsification of ex-Wirecard exec's travel records
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The National Bureau of Investigation on Thursday said it filed criminal complaints against two Bureau of Immigration officers for alleged falsification of travel records of Jan Marsalek, former executive of scandal-hit Wirecard AG.

item.title: No truth to QCPD 'no forced entry' in Echanis case, Anakpawis says
item.description: "Police claim that Echanis voluntarily opened his door or knew his killers, in a brazen attempt for a cover-up; but the crime scene says otherwise," Ariel Casilao, former Anakpawis Representative said in a statement on Thursday.

item.title: Private school teachers lobby for better aid, wage subsidy in Bayanihan 2
item.description: "We reiterate that a one-time cash assistance of [P5,000-P8,000] will not rectify the past [six] months of state neglect, and will not at all suffice to cover our present needs. We deserve more than just crumbs from the government," ACT Private Schools Secretary-General Jonathan Geronimo said.

item.title: DOJ probe into Echanis' case to proceed after PNP finally acknowledges victim identity
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: After the delay due to a supposed “confusion” on the victim’s identity, the Department of Justice task force investigating cause-oriented killings will start looking into the murder of peasant activist Randall Echanis.

item.title: Tropical depression Gener now inside PAR
item.description: (Updated 11:40 a.m.) “Gener” was the seventh tropical cyclone that entered the country’s jurisdiction this year.

item.title: Go: Reforms necessary to rid PhilHealth of corruption
item.description: Institutional reforms in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. are necessary to solve the problems plaguing the agency, Sen. Bong Go said yesterday.

item.title: ‘P10 billion not realignment of tourism aid’
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Deputy Speaker for finance and Camarines Sur Rep. LRay Villafuerte reassured stakeholders of the tourism industry of the support of Congress but clarified that the P10-billion allocation is only an initial stimulus outlay and not a realignment of their budget as industry leaders claimed.
